revised_title: Observations on the Foramina Thebesii and their Role in Heart Function
tldr: The author, John Abernethy, examines the foramina Thebesii, unique openings in the heart's blood vessels, and their role in maintaining heart health. He explains how these foramina help prevent disease by allowing blood to flow into the heart's cavities and relieve pressure in nutrient vessels. Abernethy also discusses the foramen ovale, a natural opening between the heart's left and right atria, and how it can renew in cases of pulmonary disease to maintain proper blood circulation.
